channel.title: Making pickup command work for user rank 2 and 3 but not 4
channel.description:
As title says. Project insanity
not sure how, my guess was if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup") && c.playerRights == 3 && c.playerRights == 2) {
but this stopped the command working as opposed to without && c.playerRights == 2.
all help appreciated thanks

item.title: Making pickup command work for user rank 2 and 3 but not 4
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“avirunes, post:16, topic:383869”]Thanks all for the help

^you don’t understand what he wants…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup") && c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {

What you did was saying if the player had both rights 3 and 2 which was technically impossible, it would work. Use the || operator for OR.

In fact, you don’t win either.

With this code every time someone with playerRights of 2 enters a code the pickup command will be activated. As there will be no variables in the code they do this will cause the game to crash.

The code you want is:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup")) { if (c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {

The last post was the right code, the one before that was strange as i don’t understand why, but it made every command a spawning command. Ie if a player used ::agility 995 2147000000 they would spawn max cash lol[/quote]

It is because the code read to the computer as:

If the player has entered the code pickup and they have right of 3 OR if the player has rights of 2 (no matter what code is entered) do the pickup command.

Read full topic
item.source: Making pickup command work for user rank 2 and 3 but not 4

item.title: Making pickup command work for user rank 2 and 3 but not 4
item.dc:creator: @avirunes avirunes
item.description:
@avirunes wrote:

Thanks all for the help

[quote=“Tatemo, post:15, topic:383869”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=479631.msg3511756#msg3511756 date=1298633590]
^you don’t understand what he wants…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup") && c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {

What you did was saying if the player had both rights 3 and 2 which was technically impossible, it would work. Use the || operator for OR.
[/quote]

In fact, you don’t win either.

With this code every time someone with playerRights of 2 enters a code the pickup command will be activated. As there will be no variables in the code they do this will cause the game to crash.

The code you want is:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup")) { if (c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {[/quote]

The last post was the right code, the one before that was strange as i don’t understand why, but it made every command a spawning command. Ie if a player used ::agility 995 2147000000 they would spawn max cash lol

Read full topic
item.source: Making pickup command work for user rank 2 and 3 but not 4

item.title: Making pickup command work for user rank 2 and 3 but not 4
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:3, topic:383869”]^you don’t understand what he wants…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup") && c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {

What you did was saying if the player had both rights 3 and 2 which was technically impossible, it would work. Use the || operator for OR.[/quote]

In fact, you don’t win either.

With this code every time someone with playerRights of 2 enters a code the pickup command will be activated. As there will be no variables in the code they do this will cause the game to crash.

The code you want is:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup")) { if (c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {

Read full topic

less than or equal to 3 AND more than or equal to 2.
